experience.description: At Indra, I lead the comprehensive management of the QA cycle in the assigned cell of our telecom project. During each sprint, we focus on improving processes related to mobile services such as portability, package purchases, top‑ups, and roaming.
responsibilities: Designing and executing test scenarios and cases.
Developing and evaluating the test plan and strategy for the assigned cell.

experience.description: I successfully executed a project for Asocombia, a non‑profit association dedicated to promoting sustainable agriculture and offering fresh, high‑quality products. The objective of this project was to create a dynamic landing page with a primary focus on encouraging users to request more information.
responsibilities: Created an appealing and user‑friendly design.
Ensured efficient integration with Asocombia's communication channels.
Conducted thorough testing for functionality and performance.
Delivered a professional and engaging landing page that encouraged users to request further information.

experience.description: I participated in the Valhalla Series project, which aimed to manage user information for a sporting event. Users could register and access their data categorized by date of birth and gender. Administrative users could consult and take actions on records.
responsibilities: Design and develop the user interface.

experience.description: At Q‑Vision, I participated in several energy projects, providing QA support and assuming full‑cycle responsibility. Additionally, I conducted requirement gathering for select banking projects.
responsibilities: Design and execute scenarios and test cases.
Prepare and evaluate the test plan and test strategy for the project in charge.
Manage applications for monitoring incident reports.

experience.description: As part of the Team Piedra del Canadá, I worked on a project aimed at managing user information for a sporting event. Users were able to register and access their personal data, which was categorized based on their date of birth and gender. An authorized administrator could access and modify this information, including changing the status of user records.
